## Cannabis industry overall revenue (not just taxes)
**Washington state** reported in 2019 1.1 billion in sales.   
Source: https://www.tre.wa.gov/portfolio-item/washington-state-marijuana-revenues-and-health/   

In 2020, it reached 1.26 billion.   
Source: https://www.cannabisbenchmarks.com/cannabis-sales-in-washington-up-in-2020/   

**Oregon** sold 795 million of cannabis in 2019, and 1.11 billion in 2020.   
Source: https://mjbizdaily.com/oregon-marijuana-sales-reach-record-1-billion-plus-in-2020/#:~:text=The%20Oregonian%20reported%20that%20total%20cannabis%20sales%20in,a%20record%20year%20for%20the%20state%E2%80%99s%20cannabis%20companies   

**Colorado** reported 1,747,990,628 billion in sales in 2019.   
Source: https://www.colorado.gov/pacific/revenue/colorado-marijuana-sales-reports   

In 2020, Colorado surpassed 2 billion dollars in revenue.   
Source: https://cdor.colorado.gov/data-and-reports/marijuana-data/marijuana-sales-reports    

**Nevada** in 2019 reported 639 million in sales.   
Source: https://mjbizdaily.com/nevada-marijuana-sales-rise-to-639-million-in-fiscal-year-2019/   

In 2020, Nevada sold 685 million in cannabis.    
Source: https://www.statista.com/statistics/1076957/total-cannabis-sales-in-nevada/   

**California** sold 2 billion in 2019 and in 2010 over 4.4 billion of cannabis products.    
Source: https://cannabusinessplans.com/california-cannabis-market/#:~:text=In%202020%2C%20California%20retail%20stores%20sold%20%244.4%20billion,Oregon%20represented%20over%2050%20percent%20of%20U.S.%20sales.  

**Massachussetts** made 445 million in sales of cannabis in 2019.   
Source: https://www.marketwatch.com/story/massachusetts-to-sell-900-million-worth-of-weed-in-2020-says-analyst-2020-01-24#:~:text=Massachusetts%20had%20a%20%22strong%22%20first%20full%20year%20of,Commission.%20Burleson%20expects%202020%20sales%20of%20%24900%20million.   

In 2020, sales reached 702 million.   
Source: https://masscannabiscontrol.com/2021/09/massachusetts-marijuana-establishments-surpass-2-billion-in-gross-sales/
source.40a8f2fa:
**Conclusions**   
I explored updates to US cannabis revenue from certain states with recreational cannabis.       
Did tax revenue increased?  
Yes. Even with the impact of the pandemic, the cannabis industry tax revenue increased.   

Did crime rate differ? Yes, in some states it rose and in others it decreased. With all    
the socio-political factors not discussed here, it would be irresponsible to correlate these two variables.   

How do other industries compare to the cannabis industry?   
There are many variables (varied indsutries, varied states, COVID, and economy) imppacting gains and loses.   
Cannabis industry performed steadily: it gained revenue in all states studied from 2019 to 2020.   
Other industries may be too varied to compare.   
California did well in both industries (cannabis and wine), while Washington state's wine industry lost revenue in 2020,    
while cannabis performed well.

source.3d3ba9c4:
**Purpose**: To show updates to prior data analysis of US cannabis sales and revenue from states with recreational cannabis.      

According to Leafly, https://www.leafly.com/learn/legalization/recreational-states , as of January 2022, there are 19 states with recreational cannabis. In the previous version, I focused on 6 states. In this version, I include 2 more states for evaluation.   

However, the industries dont exist in a vacuum: COVID, economic instability, and differing rules about what the industry entails makes it hard to reach sound conclusion from this information.    

Hypotheses:    
1) Did tax revenue increase?   
2) Did crime rate differ?  
3) How do other industries compare to the cannabis industry?

Limitation of data:   
The reliability of the sources vary, these are not peer-reviewed numbers. I rely on state data or commercial websites.    
Finding the official numbers for 2020 is challenging, even in 2022. COVID impacted this as well.   
While there are other states with cannabis industries, I limit to 8 of 19 states with some recreational businesses.    
Therefore, the scope is limited to informational purposes. Researchers could take upon this data to explore and expand upon.

## 1. Tax Revenue   
A. The average tax income from cannabis sales for 2020 was 304.2 million, the 2019 average was 255.1 million.      
B. California and Washington benefited the most from cannabis tax revenue of the 8 states discussed for 2020.   

## 2. Crime   
A. Some states reported an increase in crime from 2019 to 2020. Other states reported a decrease.   
B. Many socio-political problems occuring to make any correlation.    

## 3. Industries, compared  
A. California had profitable wine and cannabis industries for 2019 and 2020. Both did very well, in spite of other variables.   
B. The Nevada casino industries brings in much more than cannabis does into the state. But casinos suffered significant loses in 2020.   
C. Cannabis industries gained reveune from 2019 to 2020 in all states observed.   
D. Different taxes, markets, rules, et.c may impact the amount brought in the industry in each state.
